D while some other essential vitamin

is able to be synthesized in your skin
by a photosynthetic reaction that can be

radiation vitamin D is essential for
supporting your bone integrity and has a
protective role against chronic
morbidities such as diabetes and
cardiovascular diseases low vitamin D
levels have been linked to poor bone
health and more recent findings seem to
correlate in adequate amounts of this
precious vitamin to problems ranging
from multiple sclerosis to prostate
cancer if you were never exposed to any
sunlight you would almost definitely be
lacking in this important nutrient
